intro: Bunium bulbocastanum var. peucedanoides, commonly known as the European cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–100 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white flowers. Its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks.
